intro: Nemesia hanoverica, commonly known as the Hanover nemesis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Nemesia hanoverica is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
